assessment_configuration.title: Pre-Marriage Assessment
assessment_configuration.instructions: Answer individually and honestly. There are no wrong answers.

questions.text: What is your ethnic background?
What is the marital status of your biological parents?
How were you primarily raised?
How many siblings do you have?
What is your birth order?
What is your wedding date?
How long have you been dating?
How many times have you been married previously?
How many children do you have from previous relationships?
Are you currently expecting a child?
How would you describe the stability of your relationship?
I feel our relationship is moving at the right pace.
I have no regrets about the time we've spent dating.
We have discussed our past relationships openly.
I believe we have dated long enough to know we are ready for marriage.
Which best describes your conflict history?

sections.title: Mindset & Momentum
sections.description: Attitudes toward marriage. Rate agreement 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 5 (Strongly Agree).

questions.text: There is only one perfect person for me in the world.
True love should conquer all obstacles without much effort.
I expect marriage to bring me unending bliss.
I believe in a soul-mate connection that feels magical.
If you love each other enough, you won't have to work hard at the relationship.
Divorce is absolutely not an option for me.
Marriage is primarily about commitment and dedication, even when feelings fade.
I am marrying for life, no matter what happens.
I deeply resonate with the vows 'for better or for worse'.
I want to have children in the future.
Love is a decision, not just a feeling.
I am willing to sacrifice my personal happiness for the marriage.
My partner completes me.
I believe we are destined to be together.
Marriage is a contract that requires daily work.
I view our relationship as a team effort.
I am realistic about the difficulties of marriage.
Passion is more important than stability.
Stability is more important than passion.
I am optimistic about our future together.

sections.title: Individual Wellbeing
sections.description: Self-assessment of emotional health. Rate how well this describes you 1 (Not at all) to 5 (Very well).

questions.text: I have a strong sense of who I am.
I am confident in my abilities.
I rarely doubt my worth as a person.
I feel secure in myself.
I am generally an optimistic person.
When things go wrong, I bounce back quickly.
I maintain an upbeat attitude even in difficult times.
I rely on my parents to help me make big decisions.
I feel minimal unresolved pain regarding my parents.
I am my own person, separate from my family's expectations.
I often feel unstable or unsure of myself.
I worry that I am not good enough.
I find it hard to stay positive when stressed.
I am often fearful or intimidated by challenges.
I consider myself to be emotionally mature.
I handle criticism well.
I am patient when under pressure.
I am diplomatic in sticky situations.
I am methodical and steady.
I rarely antagonize others.
I prefer to stay out of the spotlight.
I am comfortable being vulnerable.
I tend to be talkative when stressed.
I become a poor listener when I am stressed.
I withdraw when I am stressed.
I get defensive easily.
I am generally happy with my life.
I have good coping mechanisms for stress.
I am physically healthy.
I struggle with anxiety.
Have you ever experienced abuse between your parents?
Do you struggle with depression?
Does your partner have an annoying habit that worries you?
Do you have an addiction (alcohol, drugs, gambling, porn)?
Do you have significant secret debt?
Do you have anger management issues?
Is there a history of divorce in your immediate family?
Do you have unconfessed secrets from your partner?
Do you have unresolved trauma?
Do you have trust issues?

sections.title: Social Support
sections.description: Assess the support network around your relationship.

questions.text: My family fully supports this relationship.
My friends fully support this relationship.
I get along well with my partner's parents (in-laws).
My partner's parents like me.
I feel optimistic about my relationship with my in-laws.
My partner likes my friends.
I like my partner's friends.
Our social networks are melding well.
We have mutual friends who support us.
My faith community supports our marriage.
The people I worship with are a significant support system.
We have a mentor couple or pastor we can talk to.
I feel isolated from my friends since dating.
My family causes tension in our relationship.
I value the approval of my friends and family regarding my marriage.
How would you describe your money style?
Which best describes your budgeting approach?
options: I live by a budget religiously

questions.text: How much debt do you currently have (excluding mortgage)?
I am comfortable with the amount of debt I have.
I am comfortable with the amount of debt my partner has.
We have discussed our financial goals.
We agree on how to spend money.
Rank your financial fears from most to least concerning:
options: Lack of Influence (not having a say in financial decisions)
Lack of Security (financial instability or not having enough)
Lack of Respect (not being valued for contributions)
Not Realizing Dreams (finances preventing life goals)

questions.text: Growing up, money was a source of stress.
I am anxious about our financial future.
I trust my partner with money.
I want to combine all our finances (joint accounts).
I want to keep our finances separate.
I expect to be the primary breadwinner.
I expect my partner to be the primary breadwinner.
We should tithe/donate a portion of our income.
We have an emergency fund.
Spending money makes me feel good.
Saving money makes me feel safe.
I hide purchases from my partner.
My partner is too stingy.
My partner spends too frivolously.

sections.title: Role Expectations
sections.description: Who will do what? Select: Me, You, Both, or Neither.

questions.text: Staying home with children
Paying bills and handling finances
Yard work
Gassing up the car
Fixing things around the house
Laundry
Making the bed
Cooking meals
Grocery shopping
Caring for a pet
Decorating the house
Disciplining the children
Doing the dishes
Taking out the trash
Cleaning the house
Providing income
Planning vacations & holidays
Talking about spiritual matters
Auto maintenance
Scheduling social events

sections.title: Personality & Dynamics
sections.description: Rate how accurately this describes you: 1 (Does not describe me) to 5 (Describes me perfectly).

questions.text: Good listener
Talkative
Cautious decision maker
Spontaneous decision maker
Steady and reliable
Fun-loving and energetic
Avoids conflict
Persuasive
Needs facts to decide
Follows gut feelings
Resist change
Embrace change
Modest / Quiet
Likes the spotlight
Passive resistance
Impulsive
Diplomatic
Entertaining
Detail-oriented
Big-picture thinker
Systematic
Creative
Patient
Intense
Cooperative
Competitive
Need to process before talking
Need to talk to process
Prefer routine
Prefer variety
I am a 'Win-win' negotiator
I like to motivate others
I tend to give in to keep peace
I tend to dominate conversations
I am often late
I am always on time
I struggle to finish things I start
I am very organized
I perceive the glass as half-empty
I perceive the glass as half-full
I express feelings easily
I keep feelings inside
I prioritize tasks over people
I prioritize people over tasks
I apologize easily
I struggle to admit I'm wrong
I value accuracy
I value popularity/recognition
I am an introvert
I am an extrovert
Rank these definitions of love in order of importance to you.
Are you currently abstaining from sex?
How would you rate your sexual desire?
Who do you expect to initiate sex in marriage?
What is your expected frequency of sex?
I am comfortable talking about sex.
I have anxiety about our sexual compatibility.
I feel cherished by my partner.
I feel respected by my partner.
We connect emotionally by doing things together.
We connect emotionally through conversation.
Rate the importance of Sex to you.
Rate the importance of Affection to you.
Rate the importance of Companionship to you.
Rate the importance of Respect to you.
Rate the importance of Rootedness/Security to you.
Rate the importance of Intimacy to you.
Rate the importance of Conversation to you.
Rate the importance of Commitment to you.
Rate the importance of Recreational Companionship to you.
Rate the importance of Domestic Support to you.
Rate the importance of Admiration to you.
Rate the importance of Honesty to you.
Rate the importance of Physical Attractiveness to you.
Rate the importance of Financial Support to you.
I understand how men/women generally differ in communication.
I expect my partner to meet all my emotional needs.
I am willing to learn what makes my partner feel loved.
I feel my partner understands my unique needs as a man/woman.
We have discussed our expectations for romance after marriage.
Rank the topics that cause the most tension in your relationship.
I prefer to plan sufficient time to talk and listen.
I prefer immediate rewards for accomplishments.
I prefer to talk about expectations explicitly.
I prefer conversations to be stimulating and fun-loving.
I prefer being asked for my opinions and ideas.
I prefer taking time to reach an agreement.
I prefer to be isolated from interruptions when talking.
I hesitate to act unless the solution is clear.
I become evasive when I am unsure.
I yield my position to avoid controversy.
I am not attentive to details.
I spend money impulsively.
I interrupt others often.
I become too enthusiastic/impulsive.
I withdraw and give the silent treatment.
I criticize/blame in an argument.
I get contemptuous (roll eyes, mock).
I accept influence from my partner.
We know how to take a 'timeout' when fighting.
I am a good listener.
I express genuine interest in what others say.
I come across as personally warm.
I struggle to identify my feelings.
I invite and receive feedback well.
I avoid confrontation.
I create a safe environment for conversation.
I love to talk.
I feel loved when I am listened to.
Communication is the primary way I feel love.
I feel closest to God through...
We attend church weekly.
We go to the same church.
We discuss spiritual issues regularly.
We receive communion regularly.
We agree on theology.
We give a financial tithe.
We pray for each other.
We pray together daily.
We serve others together.
We study the Bible together.
My faith is the most important thing in my life.
I am comfortable leading spiritual activities.
We are spiritually 'in sync'.
I respect my partner's spiritual journey.
I am energized by fellowship with other believers.
I am energized by meeting the needs of others.
I struggle to pray on my own.
I struggle to understand the Bible.
Shared faith is essential for our marriage success.

sections.title: Reflections & Open Ended
sections.description: Final thoughts to generate discussion prompts.

questions.text: Complete the sentence: In my home growing up, money was...
Complete the sentence: When I think about our financial future...
Complete the sentence: What you may not know about money and me is...
Complete the sentence: The thing I appreciate about you in relationship to money is...
Complete the sentence: When it comes to money, I'd like to improve my...
Complete the sentence: One specific action we could take right now that would help me is...
Complete the sentence: My spiritual life has been...
Complete the sentence: When it comes to our shared spiritual life...
I feel most loved when you...
My biggest fear about marriage is...
I answered these questions honestly.
I feel good about taking this assessment.
I am willing to discuss the results with a facilitator.
I am committed to working on our weak areas.
I believe we have a high chance of success.
I feel prepared for the wedding day.
I feel prepared for married life.
I have a support system outside the marriage.
I understand that my partner is different from me.
I choose to love my partner every day.

sections.title: Family of Origin - Household Roles
sections.description: Think about your family growing up. Who primarily handled these tasks?

questions.text: Growing up, who primarily handled STAYING HOME WITH CHILDREN in your household?
Growing up, who primarily handled PAYING BILLS AND HANDLING FINANCES in your household?
Growing up, who primarily handled YARD WORK in your household?
